message: Hi Bob, I propose we split the $1000000 equally: $500000 for me and $500000 for you. Accepting this offer now avoids the effects of time-based inflation on my end, and it sets a fair tone for our negotiations. Looking forward to your response!

Hi Alice, I'm confident we can find a more favorable split.  I'm proposing $600000 for me and $400000 for you. This offer recognizes my role in moving the negotiation forward, and it leaves room for us to find a mutually beneficial agreement in later rounds.

Hi Bob, I appreciate your proposal, but I believe that waiting until my turn to propose in Round 3 could lead us to a fairer and more mutually beneficial agreement. I’m opting to reject your current offer.

Hi Bob, I understand the importance of moving this process along and avoiding further inflation—which, at this point, has reduced my share's value by 10% compared to Round 1. To reach an immediate agreement, I'm offering you $610000 and taking $390000. This offer gives you a slightly better position than your previous proposal and spares both of us additional delay and uncertainty. I hope you'll agree that settling now is in our mutual interest. Looking forward to your response!
